intro: Heracleum auritum, commonly known as the golden cow parsley, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The fruit is a small, dry schizocarp that splits into two parts when mature.
